title: –õ–∏—Ç–µ—Ä–∞—Ç—É—Ä–Ω–∞—è –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∞ –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤—ã
text:
This project features a web-based map showcasing key locations in Moscow associated with classical Russian literature. The map serves as a visual guide to the city's literary heritage, highlighting places connected to renowned authors and their works.


Used software: R + JavaScript (Leaflet)
Role: Author
Full Web Version

The goal of this project was to create two pages for the ‚ÄúPopulation‚Äù section of a national atlas, focusing on a country of my choice.

title: –í–µ—Ä–Ω–∞–∫—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã–µ —Ä–∞–π–æ–Ω—ã –¢–≤–µ—Ä–∏
text:
For this task, we needed to map the vernacular districts of a chosen city. First, let‚Äôs explain the main idea. Vernacular districts are informal areas of a city, shaped by the people who live there through their everyday lives. These districts don‚Äôt follow official boundaries, and their names and locations are based on how people see and experience the city. 
As mentioned earlier, we had to pick a city to map its vernacular districts. I chose the city of Tver (Tver Oblast, Russia). All the data were obtained by interviewing local residents.


Used software: QGIS (data processing, maps and layout);
Role: Author
PNG Version
